availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, tanner. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Power Fleming. Father of Cybel Fleming, Martha J. Gleming, Malvina Fleming, James Fleming, Richard H. Fleming, Franklin Fleming, John Fleming, Walter Fleming, Hugh Fleming, Ida Fleming, and Florence Fleming. Farmer in Fleming County in 1850. Tanner in Fleming County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1850 and three in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 334. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 855. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Flemingsburg, p. 393.
